div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1604 Thalalaia, c. 5 km. SW of Zahle, Coelesyria, 1952 Burial: c. 120 B.C. (Westermark) Contents: 24+ AR Antiochus VII: 8 tetradr. (Tyre, yrs. 176, 177, 181, 182) Demetrius II: 6 tetradr. (Tyre, yrs. 183, 185, 186) Tyre: 10 tetradr. (yrs. 3, 4, 5) Disposition: dispersed Seyrig, Tr√©sors du Levant (in press) Rubbings at ANS A lot of twenty coins (Antiochus VII, Tyre 5; Demetrius II, Tyre 7; Tyre auton. 8) was recorded by Seyrig, who noted one coin of Tyre from yr. 6. The two lots may contain duplicates
